newsitem.title: TURKEY: New Turkish government affirms EU membership aim.
newsitem.headline: New Turkish government affirms EU membership aim.

text.p: The Turkish government of secularist Prime Minister Mesut Yilmaz promised on Monday to persevere with the country's drive to win full membership of the European Union.
"Turkey will ensure its rightful place in the new Europe that is being drawn up," said a government plan of action to be read in parliament later in the day.
The document also promised rapid harmonisation of laws to ease a customs union between Turkey and the EU that began last year.
The previous Islamist-led government was slow in making needed legislative changes to comply with the pact, which gave Turkey some of the closest ties to the EU of any non-member country.
Turkey is one of 12 countries awaiting a July 16 European Commission judgement on how suitable each is for EU entry.
A shaky economy, disputes with EU member Greece and a poor human rights record all stand in the way of Turkish membership.
